DataElement.preferredName: Progressive Disease Refuse Or Intolerance Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related progression of disease despite of therapy or refusal or tolerance as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Progressive Disease Refuse Or Intolerance Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Property.preferredName: Refuse Or Intolerance Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has prostate cance
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has prostate cancer, does patient have confirmed metastatic disease that has progressed despite hormonal therapy or refused or is intolerant of hormonal therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the six-patient safety cohort, has patient progressed or is intolerant, or declines systemic therapy associated with clinically significant survival benefit if checkpoint blockade is not an approved or accepted treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed on, been intolerant to / ineligible for, or refused prior standard of care anti-PD-1 based immunotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed on, been intolerant to, is ineligible for, or has refused prior standard of care anti-PD-1 based immunotherapy?
